meanings.definition: The act of pretending or claiming to be something one is not.
meanings.sent1: Her pretension of being a skilled pianist was quickly exposed when she sat down to play.
meanings.sent2: His pretension to the throne was met with skepticism by the royal council.
meanings.sent3: The cat's pretension of being a fierce lion was shattered when it got scared by a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The politician's pretension of honesty was like a thin veil that everyone could see through.
meanings.sent5: The pretension of the haunted house made it seem scarier than it actually was.

meanings.definition: A claim or assertion of a claim to something.
meanings.sent1: The company's pretension to the top spot in the industry was backed by years of hard work.
meanings.sent2: Her pretension to the title of best baker in town was well-deserved.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's pretension to the entire tree as its territory was comically challenged by a family of birds.
meanings.sent4: His pretension to the crown was like a challenge thrown at the reigning king.
meanings.sent5: The pretension of the old library to hold the rarest books in the world was not unfounded.
